History of Present Illness:
The patient (___) is a ___ F w/ PMH SCC of
lung, T2DM, CKD, gout presenting with seizure.

Her son tells me that patient was in her usual state of health
this week. Today around 11:30 AM or so he heard a noise from her
room he went up and found her on the ground and that she 
appeared
to be seizing.  Her arms and legs were extended and stiff.  This
lasted for perhaps a few minutes, he is not sure of exact
timeframe but it stopped for EMS arrived.  She slid onto the
floor and was mumbling.  When EMS arrived she was able to answer
some of the EMS questions.  She was brought to ___.  Per EMS left arm and leg were flaccid on the scene. 
Patient was taken to CT scanner, which showed a ___ lesion 
with
surrounding edema. At ___ she in the emergency room was
documented as having a generalized seizure.  No further details
were available regarding what this looked like.  She received 2
mg Ativan and was intubated presumably for airway protection. 
She was given Keppra and dexamethasone,   And transferred here.
Lactate was 5.5. Other labs mostly unremarkable. UA wnl. Her son
states she had not reported any headache or weakness or other
neurological symptoms prior to today. He was not aware of her
having any infectious symptoms.

She was found to have a R lung mass in ___ after imaging,
done for symptoms of dyspnea and chest pressure. Bronchoscopy 
non
diagnostic. CT guided biopsy showed SCC. PET scan on ___ showed
only local disease. The lung cancer was pending further
management following her most recent clinic visit.

Pt unable to state ROS

DIAGNOSTICS:
------------------
MR ___ ___:
IMPRESSION:  
1. Multiple heterogeneously enhancing masses within the right
cerebral hemisphere with surrounding vasogenic edema, compatible
with metastases. 
2. There is mild mass effect on the right lateral ventricle
without midline 
shift, uncal herniation or basilar cisternal effacement. 

CTH w/o contrast (___):
Areas of vasogenic edema in the right parietal and right frontal
lobe and insula with suggestion of underlying masses concerning
for intracranial metastases.  No intracranial hemorrhage. 

CT Torso (___):
6.7 cm right lower lobe lung mass consistent with known primary
lung cancer. No acute intrathoracic or intra-abdominal process.
Fusiform infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring up to 
3.8
Cm. 

CT CSpine (___):  
No acute fracture.  Mild anterolisthesis of C2 on C3 and C7 on 
T1
are likely degenerative in etiology.  Moderate multilevel
degenerative changes of the cervical spine as described above.
Enlarged, heterogeneous thyroid gland with multiple nodules.

EKG:
IMAGING:
Non-Contrast CT of Head: ___ ___
Impression: 
1. Partly necrotic metastases of the right parietal post 
Central,
right anterior subinsular, right frontal basal and right middle
frontal gyri regions, with vasogenic edema. Slight leftward
midline
shift of septum pellucidum. Further evaluation with
gadolinium-enhanced MRI recommended when clinically appropriate.
2. No acute hemorrhage, acute infarction.

 
Brief Hospital Course:
___ F with known SCC of the lung (Dx ___ presented after
seizure at home found to have right sided ___ mets with
vasogenic edema, initially requiring intubation for airway
protection. After loading with Keppra, she had no further 
seizure activity. She was put on dexamethasone for vasogenic 
edema surrounding her mets. She was evaluated by radiation 
oncology and underwent mapping for SBRT. She was seen by medical 
oncology. She had an unstable L shoulder dislocation requiring 
multiple reductions by orthopedic surgery and was placed in a 
sling. 

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES:
[ ] Will need to follow up with orthopedic surgery regarding her 
unstable L shoulder
[ ] If further dislocations, please call the ___ orthopedics 
clinic for her to be seen urgently for reduction. She does not 
need to go to the ED as long as minimal pain with intact motor, 
sensation, and pulse.
[ ] Please contact Dr. ___ at ___ ___ Oncology for 
further direction regarding steroid taper.
[ ] Please ensure she is seen in ___ Oncology Clinic 
(Thoracics)
[ ] Loading dose apixaban 10 mg bid, can decrease to regular 
maintenance dose apixaban 5 mg BID on ___.

# Right sided ___ metastases with Vasogenic Edema 
# Seizures
Presented following fall, found to have new right sided ___
mets with vasogenic edema, confirmed by MRI. EEG with no
epileptiform activity following loading with Keppra 1500 mg BID. 
She was started on dexamethasone 6 mg q6h, tapered to 4 mg q8h. 
She was seen by neurosurgery, radiation oncology, 
neuro-oncology, medical oncology. Plan is for stereotactic ___ 
radiation (3 fractions) ___. She will need to 
follow up in clinic with medical oncology to discuss further 
diagnostics and whether she may be a candidate for systemic 
therapies with palliative intent. She was seen by palliative 
care inpatient and can continue to follow with them in clinic if 
she desires.

# Acute Hypoxemic Respiratory Failure
Likely atelectasis with possible mild volume overload. Received 
40 mg IV Lasix with Cr bump. No clear indication for maintenance 
diuretic.

#Esstential HTN
Continued Metoprolol tartrate 50 mg BID, Amlodipine 5mg daily, 
held lisinopril given normotension

#Left anterior shoulder dislocation
No e/o dislocation on initial XR, likely was moving in and out 
of
joint, as subsequently confirmed on repeat XR. Required multiple 
reductions and exam under anesthesia. Arm in sling. Per ortho 
team:
-NWB LUE in sling and swathe
-No shoulder ROM
-Follow-up 2 weeks with Dr. ___ sling and swathe, please ensure that one white strap goes
around the patient's neck, one white strap goes around the
patient's waist, and the large padded blue/gray swathe is 
wrapped
around the patient's waist and goes around the sling.

#RIJ thrombus 
Discussed w Dr. ___ neuro-oncology, ok for AC, so 
started apixaban.

# Squamous Cell Carcinoma 
Diagnosed in ___, opting to not receive surgery since that
time with conservative monitoring. PET in ___ without
evidence of metastatic disease, but now w ___ mets as above

#Normocytic Anemia
Stable. No evidence of bleeding  

#Gout
home Allopurinol

#HLD
-Continued statin 

#T2DM
-held Trulicity, ISS while in ___

# CODE: DNR/OK to intubate

WHAT WAS DONE WHILE I WAS IN THE HOSPITAL?
- You had an MRI that showed that your lung cancer has spread to 
your ___
- You were given steroids to help with the swelling in your 
___ from this
- You were given medicines to prevent seizures
- You had your shoulder put back in place

give the radiation therapy to your ___

WHAT SHOULD I DO WHEN I LEAVE THE HOSPITAL?
- Work with ___ to get stronger
- Go to your ___ radiation sessions

a good option for you
- Talk to the palliative care doctors about any ___ you may 
be having

Your ___ Care Team

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
